greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to write n as x^2 + 2*y^2 + 2^z + 3*2^w with x,y,z,w nonnegative integers.
comment: Clearly, a(2*n) > 0 if a(n) > 0. We have verified a(n) > 0 for all n = 4..6*10^9.
See also A302982 and A302984 for similar conjectures.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Zhi-Wei Sun, Refining Lagrange's four-square theorem, J. Number Theory 175(2017), 167-190.
Zhi-Wei Sun, New conjectures on representations of integers (I), Nanjing Univ. J. Math. Biquarterly 34(2017), no. 2, 97-120.
Zhi-Wei Sun, Restricted sums of four squares, arXiv:1701.05868 [math.NT], 2017-2018.
results.author: _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Apr 16 2018
